description: Thanks ?️! It works perfectly !!
I am automatically signed out after every reboot ....
Good game engine

Honestly this package here has installing Unity down to a very simple process, the way it should be. Everything works great.
Furthermore, you don't even need to install a different editor for Linux, it uses the same exe as your windows editor.
This saves me a lot of bandwidth, as I can just backup my editor to my external drive, and plug it into whichever system I'm working
from, and it boots just fine. I have trouble getting my work done in Windows, this saves me an awful lot of headache. Thank you, to
whoever put this flatpak together, thank you very much!
It has been pending for more than at least 5 hours. And STILL PENDING.

Unity what's your problem? I'm running Fedora 33, nothing from Unity works. Not even installing from Flatpak like some users have suggested. Godot Engine, an open source competitor works just fine. To all of you trying to make Unity work: good luck, I'm already on to my next project with Godot Engine.
summary: Godot Worked Out of the Box

description:
Won't Install 2019.4.15f1 (LTS) even without any modules.
I am logged in with an activated license file.

Add modules screen shows over 300 GB total available space.
It also shows total space required 6.8 GB.
All modules are unselected.
But when you click [DONE] it shows:
"Installation Failed"
"There is not enough space to download and install the selected items"

Random person online said they fixed this by (opening up Unity hub then reboot their PC) multiple times.

Another Random person online said they fixed this by uninstalling Unity Hub, downloading https://public-cdn.cloud.unity3d.com/hub/prod/UnityHub.AppImage into their home folder then running it from the home folder.
i don't use unity on a daily basis (i prefer godot), but this launcher just works as expected. it can manage unity versions, i can test my models. seems fine for me.

Login button doesn't work. Makes the whole App unusable!

Ok! 
So I had the issue where I could not sign-in through the UI with the sign in button and the create account hyperlink.

I finally managed to install it by noticing the unityhub-bin icon in my taskbar. From there, I actually managed to install the engine with no further issues... 

Writing here just to let people, who face the same problem, know there is a workaround.

Furthermore I have a feeling that the issue is not related to the app itself but to SteamOS or some part of it...I am not yet 100% sure of this, but I faced a similar issue when installing the Epic Asset Manager and went with a similar workaround.

I will also report this bug ,in the morning with the hope that they will push an update that resolves this issue whatever it may be...
No issue signing in, installing, running, or building. Tested on Ubuntu 22.04 (gnome) and NixOS 22.05 (plasma) - as daily driver development environment as well as headless build server.
title says it all.

Apparently, something prevents certain apps from opening a browser with a link (hence the Signin Button does not appear to be working). 

The solution I found here made it work: https://steamcommunity.com/app/1675200/discussions/1/3395175706745309044/

Quote: "Solution: This needs to be input into the Konsole to get desktop apps to be able to open the default browser:

systemctl restart --user xdg-desktop-portal"
None of the buttons work when trying to create an account or log in. I'm now attempting to download the game engine directly.

to fix logging in type
 systemctl restart --user xdg-desktop-portal
into konsole

User below posted about it working after logging in with command. I've had the same result -- people have claimed this version crashes but I haven't noticed that yet. Hoping it works because the website direct download shown in youtube videos doesn't work for me at all and the "install to Linux" instructions on the website don't work either.
summary: Seems to work after using command to log in

description: Software seems to work well after the log in issues I encountered. If you can press the log in button, log in online but it doesn't return you to Unity Hub then use Chrome instead of firefox and open the application with xdg-open

There are multiple issues. Everything permission-related is not working through flatpak. Probably the most common error is writing to the Unity Editor Preferences file (e.g. for changing the external script editor). These always fallback to the default values

Tried signing on using my google account using the sign in with google link. Can't interact with the buttons on the sign on section. My default browser is chrome and I'm currently signed on. I'm using Steam OS.
summary: Unable to Sign In via Google

description:
Unity and some other tools have made me jaded about FlatPaks, I really don't think they are viable for developer tools. It's sad when Snaps work better. 

In this instance, I was having issues with the Flatpak VSCode (see the reviews for that for more info) and so I had to switch to an RPM installation of VSCode, however the "External Script Editor" setting in Unity won't find it, so I manually make a script to give Unity access to the VSCode install AND set the filesystem to host and it still doesn't work. 

Skip the Flatpak install and just install it from the unity site directly, they have good instructions.

I'm currently in Fedora 39 and I've used to install UnityHub by adding a repo how it's documented on official unity site, but then i found this gem, it's just perfect, one click and all just works, thank you very much for this, it's a lot easier to install. If you have some folders that are not showing just use Flatseal (I didn't have a problem with that but if you will have just use it). I have two editors installed right now (V.2022.3.20f1 && V.2022.3.18f1) and all of them work perfect.
summary: Everything Works The Way It Should Work!
